DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether a patient meets the criteria for enrolling onto a clinical trial for questions related to the interval between the prior administration of therapeutic agents that produce an effect intended to alter or stop a pathologic process as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The interval between two reference points in time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:The interval between two reference points in time.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
The interval between two reference points in time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from prior cytotoxic therapy (except 23 days for temozolomide and 6 weeks from nitrosoureas), 6 weeks from antibodies, or 4 weeks (or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter) from other anti-tumor therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of any of the following prior therapies at least 28 days prior to enrollment:  cytotoxic chemotherapy, biological therapy, such as biological response modifiers (e.g., cytokines), immunomodulatory agents, vaccines, differentiating agents, used to treat their cancer, monoclonal antibody and investigational agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient greater than or equal to 4 weeks since prior systemic cytotoxic anticancer agents, anticancer investigational agents that are not defined as immunotherapy, or for tumor-targeting monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) with the exception of alemutuzumab for which the washout is at least 24 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from prior cytotoxic therapy (except 23 days for temozolomide and 6 weeks from nitrosoureas), 6 weeks from antibodies, or 4 weeks (or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter) from other systemic anti-tumor therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of chemotherapy greater than or equal to 4 weeks (nitrosoureas or mitomycin C for 6 weeks) prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received anti-cancer treatment drug less than or equal to 21 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) prior to the first dose of AZD1775; if drug has 5 half-lives of less than or equal to 21 days, have a minimum of 10 days between termination of the prior treatment and administration of AZD1775 treatment elapsed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior systemic anti-cancer therapy, has there been a washout period of at least 3 weeks or 5 half-lives of the drug before the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off any prior therapy greater than or equal to 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas and mitomycin C) or, if known, greater than or equal to 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior therapy with drug whose 5 half-lives is less than or equal to 21 days, have less than 10 days elapsed between the termination of the prior treatment and administration of   AZD1775 treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off (washout period) prior systemic anti-cancer therapy for at least 21 days (or 5 half-lives of the systemic anti-cancer therapy, whichever is shorter) before the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 2 weeks elapsed since patient received other investigative therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have more than 4 weeks elapsed since patient received prior external beam radiation to extra-osseous disease, systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or BRAF- or non-VEGFR-targeted therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other anti-myeloma chemotherapy or radiotherapy, immunotherapy, or investigational agents within 2 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer and/or applicable) of the start of the trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last prior treatment with any chemotherapy or other investigational therapy including hormonal, biological, or targeted agents greater than or equal to 4 weeks; or at least 5 half-lives from hormonal, biological, or targeted agents, whichever is shorter at the time of treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received anti-cancer treatment drug less than or equal to 28 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) prior to the first dose of study treatment or if 5 half-lives is less than or equal to 21 days, have a  minimum of 10 days elapsed between termination of the prior treatment and administration of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 6 weeks elapsed from nitrosoureas and mitomycin C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last cellular therapy (any type) at least 42 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last prior administration of a study drug in a Phase 0 or equivalent study less than 2 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received agents other than chemotherapy, has a 4 week washout period elapsed since the last dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 7 days elapsed since the completion of therapy with a biologic agent, targeted agent, tyrosine kinase inhibitor or a metronomic non-myelosuppressive regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients undergoing leukapheresis: Prior to leukapheresis have at least 14 days elapsed since receiving pegfilgrastim?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last prior treatment with chemotherapy or radiotherapy completed at least 2 weeks before entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient meet the prior therapy criteria described in section 3.1.7: PD-1/PD-1 ICIs for NMIBC is allowed if last dose was given more than 1 year prior to randomization, Hormone-replacement therapy or oral contraceptives is allowed. Herbal therapy more than 1 week prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 (herbal therapy intended as anti-cancer therapy must be discontinued at least 1 week prior to Cycle 1, Day 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has previously received cancer-directed therapeutic agents with the potential for CYP3A4 interaction, have at least 5 half-lives elapsed before enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks or 4 prior drug half-lives (whichever is shorter) elapsed since completion of the previous systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 5-half lives elapsed?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.11 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002726. ak
